title: Ranked Based on Reports not skill.
body:
Ranking based on how you treat other players not on skill lvl is just silly.
Im a great team mate I understand how the game is played but reported by unskilled players that have a say and I don't is not fair.
To some extent what im saying is true.
If u get reported to many times your say does not get counted I seen it somewhere.
As a new or unskilled player you can not do any damage to enemy as a mid or top or ad carry and Report a player and put him in a worse standing and get put in a worse Q.
I was gold feb this year, then I got put with low silvers Qed with gold players that have no skill.
12 games straight I lost due to toxic/unskilled players. I won a couple then lost a couple and deranked.

The Ranking system is flawed, 
Players play bad get asked questions then abuse players and report which puts them in a bad Q. Its not random we all know.
What im asking is:
Please look at adjusting how Skilled players get put with unskilled players.
Kills Damage Deaths and objectives should count to placement NOT how bad players report people they assume are playing wrong.

Except it doesn't because that's what would be considered a false report. This is the thing that you can't seem to understand despite bring up the topic of false reports. Get over yourself.

> If u get reported to many times your say does not get counted I seen it somewhere.

Oh, well then it ***MUST*** be true. Hey guys, I read somewhere that the earth is flat, since I read it somewhere it ***MUST*** be true. (Are you starting to see the failure in logic here?)

Fact is the "unskilled" report option forces the system to look through your match history to determine if you are being matched with the right people by looking at various stats throughout your match history. Just because people report you for that, even if it's common, doesn't mean it will have an effect on the way you are matched with other players.

> 12 games straight I lost due to toxic/unskilled players.

Lets look at this objectively:

Assuming one AFK/DC/feeder/toxic/unskilled in every game (which is highly unlikely at most) and assuming my calculations are correct:
44% chance for a single person AFK/DC/feeder/toxic/unskilled on your team for one game.
19.36% chance for a single person AFK/DC/feeder/toxic/unskilled on your team for two games.
8.52% (rounded up to two decimal places) chance for a single person AFK/DC/feeder/toxic/unskilled on your team for three games.
3.75% (rounded up to two decimal places) chance for a single person AFK/DC/feeder/toxic/unskilled on your team for four games.
1.65% (rounded up to two decimal places) chance for a single person AFK/DC/feeder/toxic/unskilled on your team for five games.

Over 12 games it comes down to 0.00005% chance for you to be losing consecutive games as a direct result of "bad team mates". That means if you had 1,000,000 people then, statistically, only 5 of those people would experience such a thing and the fact remains theory is different from practice. In reality it could vary between about 0-10 people, and there's no way you're going to convince me you're one of those extremely unlucky individuals.

The thing that probably gets me most is that you are here blaming "bad team mates" when the main issue is your skill and attitude. Looking through your match history I can see that *sometimes* you get decent stats and *on occasion* you do well, but certainly not the kind of thing where I would say you aren't as high as you should be. In fact, given your stats and attitude, I might even argue you are a little high in rank.
